alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 11:10AM EDT until July 26 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Laurel and Rockcastle. In southeast Kentucky, Breathitt, Clay, Jackson, Lee, Owsley and Perry. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1109 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... London, McKee, Booneville, Buckhorn, Herd, Maulden, Zekes Point, Mummie, Nathanton, Elian, Tyner, Privett, Green Hall, Egypt, Mildred, Sourwood, Shepherdtown, Welchburg, Gray Hawk and Settle Store. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
